metadata.title: CVE-2023-42755 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the IPv4 Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP)classifier in the Linux kernel. The xprt pointer may go beyond the linearpart of the skb, leading to an out-of-bounds read in the `rsvp_classify`function. This issue may allow a local user to crash the system and cause adenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-ibm - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-lowlatency - 6.3.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required
